articles.title: Proposal to Hold Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu Supported
Japan Urged to Correct Distorted History Textbook
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Correct Distorted History Textbook 
    Pyongyang, February 4 (KCNA) -- Members of the History Teachers Group of the South Chungchong Provincial Chapter of the south Korean Teachers Union urged the Japanese government to correct the distorted history textbook, according to south Korea's Internet broadcasting service the Voice of People.
 In January last they visited Japan to lodge a protest with the Japanese government against instigating the ultra-right conservatives to tamper with history textbook. They handed over to the Kumamoto Prefectural Education Committee a letter warning that the use of the above-said textbook would make it impossible for the students to have a correct view on history.    
 They also demanded Japan apologize and compensate for the criminal acts it committed against the Korean people during its military occupation of Korea.
